title: OpenCEX
author: OpenCEX
content: Greetings, friends!We‚Äôre pleased to present you the first public release of OpenCEX! üöÄ We‚Äôve been working on our open-source engine for a long time and hope that you‚Äôll like it. üíùWith OpenCEX you can create your own crypto exchange for free and start your cryptocurrency business. ü™ôOpenCEX features:üî∑ Simple interface for instant swaps and advanced exchange interface for professional trading.üî∑ Quick deployment of an exchange from scratch.üî∑ Flexible settings in different sections.üî∑ Large amount of various data for detailed analysis.üî∑ Support for high-load projects.üí± Try the live demo: https://a.65.109.204.172.sslip.io/üìÇ Check out the source code: https://github.com/Polygant/OpenCEXüìí Read the documentation: https://polygant.notion.site/OpenCEX-Help-Center-8cf8c842bde947c3818a615a88ceef9c

comments.author: bettercrypto
comments.body: What do you mean by "With Opencex you can create your crypto exchange" for free? I'm not sure if I understand correctly, but do you want to convey to us here in the forum that any community here on the forum platform can have their crypto exchange in this industry?¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†Because most people know that when you build your exchange, you must have a large capital for it, and you must also have a team, and so on, then from what you are saying, it seems like it is easy to have your exchange.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: OpenCEX on March 07, 2023, 11:51:01 AMWith OpenCEX you can create your own crypto exchange for free and start your cryptocurrency business. ü™ô[/size]What's the catch?You surely wouldn't spend your time and resources creating such a good platform only for you to provide it for people to use for free. Would you?There's something we probably don't know about.How are you going to get funds to keep the project running? Donations from well-wishers?

comments.author: royalfestus
comments.body: I do not think most big investors or bag holders will risk the use of the forum because they want something cheap, aside from the fact that online security for exchanges is too costly to be rendered free or cheap. Additionally, I don't think it gives users custodial rights to their coins, which is a very dangerous offer. If you are truly interested in making such a public offering, then provide a decentralised exchange, give users custody of their coins, and request transaction fees, anything free here is suspect

comments.author: rhomelmabini
comments.body: I'm gonna compete with Binance and Coinbase with OpenCEX? This is huge and the design is very human, lol. Well, take this as a criticism but ideas like this will surely not thrive considering it takes a lot more than just creating it from scratch with you alone. Yes possibilities are endless but it's difficult to position yourself in this industry unless you really made some revolutionary feature and consider it decentralized, the CEX has a different distinction here lad.

But this doesn‚Äôt apply to the initial cost of developing the exchange as an online platform.Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on March 07, 2023, 01:49:36 PMWhat's the catch?You surely wouldn't spend your time and resources creating such a good platform only for you to provide it for people to use for free. Would you?There's something we probably don't know about.How are you going to get funds to keep the project running? Donations from well-wishers?We believe that by developing as an open-source product we can achieve much more. We want to make OpenCEX an industry standard, just like Wordpress has become for building websites. There are many examples of large-cap opens-source companies, and this is our way.We want to give the crypto community an easy and simple solution, and then make money on complex implementations for institutional players (banks, brokerage firms, etc.).

comments.author: Polygant
comments.body: Hamza2424 thanks for your opinion!we target: - Token issuers - to start the exchange of the issued token.- KOLs (bloggers, etc.) - to monetize the audience, open a crypto business and earn on commissions.- Financial institutions (Banks, brokers, payment systems) - to provide additional functionality to customers. comments.author: slaman29
comments.body: I have a question, if I wanted to sell crypto (as an exchange) or invite people to sell theirs on mine... why would I choose OpenCEX rather than just use an open DEX?Liquidity is going to be a major issue for anyone who wants to open their own CEX am I right?I ask this honestly and out of real curiosity.

comments.author: Polygant
comments.body: Quote from: slaman29 on March 14, 2023, 07:16:17 AMI have a question, if I wanted to sell crypto (as an exchange) or invite people to sell theirs on mine... why would I choose OpenCEX rather than just use an open DEX?Liquidity is going to be a major issue for anyone who wants to open their own CEX am I right?I ask this honestly and out of real curiosity.Thanks for your comment! We value every opinion.You can use the DEX to start trading your token, but what about a coin with its own blockchain? DEX won't help you here.In general, liquidity will be required in any case - it does not matter if you use DEX or CEX.You can use special liquidity robots for this.

comments.author: Polygant
comments.body: QuoteBut if I want my token that has its own blockchain, then I would have to list it on an exchange, I cannot expect people to come to a new CEX just to buy my token, right?Why not?  Your coin, branded exchange - very synergistic! We receive a lot of requests from people who would like to issue their own token and make their own exchange.At CEX, everything is the same. For example, to launch a TOKEN-USDT trading pair, you will need a certain amount of TOKENS and a certain amount of USDT. However, in the case of CEX, you have many more tools for market making. In particular, you don't have to freeze all liquidity, you only need it when a user wants to make a withdrawal from your platform.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: I'm curious about the KYT implementation with scorechain. Could you explain how it works exactly and how customizable it is for an exchange owner?

comments.author: Polygant
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on March 15, 2023, 02:21:47 PMI'm curious about the KYT implementation with scorechain. Could you explain how it works exactly and how customizable it is for an exchange owner?Every incoming deposit can be verified for KYT. If the deposit did not pass the verification (came from a bad source), it will not be collected and an alert will be sent. You can then contact the user and carry out the necessary additional checks and take the necessary actions.In order for KYT to work, you need to buy a service package from Scorechain and add the necessary keys.We also plan to add Crystal Blockchain for KYT verification (exchange owner also would need to buy the package) .
